extendedInfo.description: Harry Potter and the Methods of Rationality (HPMOR), the most popular Harry Potter fan fiction on the Net!Petunia married a professor, and Harry grew up reading science and science fiction. Then came the Hogwarts letter...Disclaimer: J. K. Rowling owns Harry Potter, and no one owns the methods of rationality.--------------------This fic is widely considered to have really hit its stride starting at around Chapter 5. If you still don't like it after Chapter 10, give up.This is not a strict single-point-of-departure fic - there exists a primary point of departure, at some point in the past, but also other alterations. The best term I've heard for this fic is "parallel universe".The pacing of the story is that of serial fiction, i.e., that of a TV show running for a predetermined number of seasons, whose episodes are individually plotted but with an overall arc building to a final conclusion.All science mentioned is real science. But please keep in mind that, beyond the realm of science, the views of the characters may not be those of the author. Not everything the protagonist does is a lesson in wisdom, and advice offered by darker characters may be untrustworthy or dangerously double-edged.-----------------HPMOR is an app that you can use to read HPMOR with your Android phone or tablet (v 2.2 and newer). It works online and offline, and automatically updates when the author adds or edits chapters. You can change fonts, font sizes and adjust the page to make it easy on your eyes.

reviews.title: Cool idea, needs some improvement
reviews.comment: It\'s pretty nice to have this dedicated app to auto update as new chapters are published out revisions made. I would prefer some tweaks to the UI, though.  There\'s no need for the menu buttons to be on screen at all times, and I probably wouldn\'t mind if the progress bar and chapter title would hide as well. Sometimes the page count gets pushed off screen by long chapter titles.  Look to Aldiko for a great unobtrusive UI for general purpose ebooks.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Not updating with new content
reviews.comment: There are now at least 10 chapters written that haven\'t been added to the app... I thought he just stopped writing for a while. Nope, the app just doesn\'t automatically update. Works great when it does, though.
reviews.author: Karen Wickert

reviews.title: Not updated w/ Ch 86
reviews.comment: Chapter 86 was just released, and Ch 85 was re-written. However, I have done extensive troubleshooting, and the current version of this app/contents doesn\'t seem to pull live from HP MoR servers... It must be manually updated by devs?!
reviews.author: Joseph Herbert

reviews.title: Needs work
reviews.comment: The story is great but the app is unusable. Nexus 4 running 4.2.1. None of the buttons work. When you press them they immediately close.
reviews.author: Christian Denney

reviews.title: Great idea, not working
reviews.comment: Love the idea of an app, but I am unable to navigate through the text. When I attempt to go to the table of contents, or access anything else, the menu instantly closes. :(
reviews.author: Molly Murphy

reviews.title: Excellent love it
reviews.comment: I love it I can\'t stop reading it thanx for making it
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.comment: Story is 5 stars think Ender takes the place of Harry

reviews.comment: Can anyone tell me how to save my page??

reviews.comment: AMAZING

reviews.title: Glitchy
reviews.comment: Good book but the app is super glitchy and slow. I have to kill it and wait for it to restart all the time when it freezes.

reviews.title: G2
reviews.comment: Force closes immediately after the app is opened.

reviews.comment: Does not seem to work on Sony Ericsson xperia. Otherwise would have loved to read it. Guess I better go find my laptop for some bedtime reading
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.comment: Good story but difficult to operate on my incredible. It skips pages on me and they are unviewable. Possibly due to my faulty phone though
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.comment: Awesome story, have been following it for a long time now. Great we now have an android app for it.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.comment: Great story, wonderful app
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.comment: Absolutely brilliant story line..
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Rating is the app not the story
reviews.comment: The story is absolutely brilliant! But the app is a bit slow and glitchy and chapters 86 & 87 are out now but the app has not been updated despite me turning on the automatic updates.
reviews.author: Catherine Schinkel

reviews.title: I\'ll download it when it works
reviews.comment: The icons and options, when selected, flash on the screen then immediately disappear. Trying to use the school bar at the bottom to pick a page is impossible. I can\'t even check how many chapters are available on this app! The page formatting via also awful, so I can\'t think of a reason to keep the app at this point. If I can\'t read it, its not useful.
reviews.author: KaNi Vargas

reviews.title: Horrible
reviews.comment: This is the most inane, pretentious fix ever. It\'s terrible. You would be better of reading My Immortal. At least that fix is funny.
reviews.author: A Google User
